view_cli module¶

Implementation of View for simple CLI console.

class view_cli.ViewCLI¶

Bases: object

Class of View implementation for CLI console. Presents a swallow user interface.

Param:

No Parameters

edit_field(field: Field) → str | None¶

Edit a field of a bookmark node. If the field type is <name>, then the valid characters for the field value are only alphabetic, numeric, and additional characters from VALID_CHARS.

Parameters:

field – tuple Field that contains the field name and the field value

Returns:

new field value or None if EOF - break

static input_line(prompt: str, valid_chars: str = '') → str | None¶

Get user input string. Filter the user input out of non-alphabetical and non-numeral characters, allow additional characters from the user template, optionally.

Parameters:

  • prompt – prompt text for the user request

  • valid_chars – template of valid characters, default to empty

Returns:

entered string, empty string if non-allowed characters were occurred, None for EOF break

static input_yes_or_no(prompt: str) → bool¶

Get user input yes or no.

Parameters:

prompt – prompt text for the user request

Returns:

True for yes and False otherwise

local_header: str¶

local header of view

main_header: str¶

main header of view

node_name: str¶

node name of the view instance

static output_header(header: str, tab: int = 0)¶

Print a header with tab spaces on the left. Fill the header with the FILL_HEADER character

Parameters:

  • header – text for heading

  • tab – optional number of tabs for a left indent, defaults to 0

Returns:

nothing

static output_list(item_list: tuple[str, ...], tab: int = 0)¶

Print a list of items with tab spaces on the left.

Parameters:

  • item_list – item list to print

  • tab – optional number of tabs for a left indent, defaults to 0

Returns:

nothing

static output_string(text: str)¶

Output a text.

Parameters:

text – a text to print

Returns:

nothing

select_field(filtered_attrs: dict[str, str], node_name: str = '') → tuple[Optional[bool], str]¶

Select a bookmark node field to edit.

Parameters:

  • filtered_attrs – ordered dictionary of the node fields to select

  • node_name – name of the bookmark node whose field is going to be edited, default to empty

Returns:

a tuple (result, index), that means: (None, ‘’) - no selection (False, ‘’) - the command ‘Return to the node selection’ (True, field name) - selected field name

select_item(item_list: tuple[str, ...], comm_list: tuple[str, ...] = (), header1: str = '', header2: str = '') → tuple[Optional[bool], int]¶

Get a custom item selection from a list of item. Submit a list in the form of a menu with numbered lines from 1 to the length of the list. Add a list of commands to the selection list, optionally. Print two headers to inform the user, optionally

Parameters:

  • item_list – list of data rows to selection

  • comm_list – list of command rows to selection, default to empty

  • header1 – header1 text, default to empty

  • header2 – header2 text, default to empty

Returns:

a tuple (result, index), that means: (None, 0) - no selection (False, index) - a command with index number was selected (True, index) - a data item with the index number was selected

static select_line(item_list: tuple[str, ...]) → int | None¶

Get a custom row selection from a list of rows. Submit a list in the form of a menu with numbered lines from 1 to the length of the list.

Parameters:

item_list – list of rows to selection

Returns:

number of the selected row or None for EOF break

view_name = 'cli'¶

the name for all cli views

view_cli.main()¶

Show main options of the class ViewCLI

Returns:

Bookmark manager (a learning project)
